word_mean: 固体地球的最外层，由地壳和上地幔的岩石所组成。

sentence.Network_en: These dissolved materials thus pass from the lithosphere to the hydrosphere.
sentence.Network_cn: 因此,这些溶解了的物质就从岩石圈转移到水圈.

sentence.Network_en: The hydrosphere and the lithosphere together form the Earth's surface.
sentence.Network_cn: 水圈与岩石圈一起形成地球的表面.

sentence.Network_en: Below the lithosphere is the rheosphere comprising partly fused peridotite.
sentence.Network_cn: 岩石圈之下是由部分熔融的橄榄岩所组成的软流圈.

means.word_mean: 1. the solid part of the earth consisting of the crust and outer mantle

auth_sentence.content: The lithosphere is broken up into tectonic plates.
auth_sentence.res_content: The lithosphere is broken up into tectonic plates.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The lithosphere is broken up into tectonic plates.

auth_sentence.content: Tectonic plates are composed of oceanic lithosphere and thicker continental lithosphere, each topped by its own kind of crust.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tectonic plates are composed of oceanic lithosphere and thicker continental lithosphere, each topped by its own kind of crust.

auth_sentence.content: The convergence area between each one of these relatively semi-homogeneus areas is the lithosphere, where we live.
